# Task

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.



# Data

df = DataFrame(dt=[DateTime(2020, 5, 24), DateTime(2021, 1, 15), DateTime(2022, 12, 5)])
add_yearmonth(df)

Here is a Julia function that solves the problem:

```julia
function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = map(x -> Dates.year(x)*100 + Dates.month(x), df[:dt])
end
```
This function uses the `map` function to apply a function to every element in a column of a DataFrame. The function takes each DateTime object and extracts the year and month, then concatenates them into an integer format "yyyymm".

Here is how you can use this function with your provided data:

```julia
using DataFrames, Dates

df = DataFrame(dt=[DateTime(2020, 5, 24), DateTime(2021, 1, 15), DateTime(2022, 12, 5)])
add_yearmonth(df)
```
After running this code, `df` will have a new column named `:ym` that contains the year and month of each DateTime as an integer in "yyyymm" format.
